intro: Astragalus qatmensis, commonly known as the Qatmen Astragalus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or semi-desert environments.
